string.text: Recoil compensator
Reduces recoil, which in turn leads to more accurate follow-up shots.
High-pressure barrel

A uniquely manufactured barrel with special rifling that forms increased pressures behind the bullet. This destabilizes it during flight and forces the bullet to take an arbitrary path on impact, forming a chaotic mess rather than a well-defined wound channel. One notable drawback to the increased damage potential is its inherent negative impact on accuracy.
Redesigned magazine retainers

The high amounts of shock and vibration generated during the firing cycle can sometimes cause the magazine retainers to come loose over time, leading to misfires or cartridge feeding issues. This is designed to solve that problem.
Barrel alignment
Calibrate barrel alignment with the sights and remove any excessive movement that occurs during the firing cycle.
Lightweight magazine
Replacing the magazine with a modern lightweight equivalent reduces the overall weight of the gun slightly.
Addition of a counterweight
Installing a counterweight in the frame according to the shooter's preference can reduce the muzzle-flip from each shot and improve perceived recoil.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Mount a tactical rail
Installing an attachment rail allows for the addition of other tactical accessories.
Combined tactical module
Combines the functions of a narrow-field tactical flashlight and laser sight. Particularly useful in low-light conditions.
Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Chamber alignment
Careful fitment of parts and minimization of backlash in the chamber for a better seal, improving accuracy.
Electroplated components
Electroplating high-stress components with a durable layer of low-friction material can increase their effective service life substantially.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Recoil compensation system
Reduces the recoil felt from each shot and leads to more comfortable, accurate shot placement.
Improved barrel locking mechanism
Provides a tighter seal in the chamber and increases bullet obturation with the bore, improving muzzle velocity.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Modification of the gas extraction system
Allows for a reduction in recoil felt by the shooter.
Lightweight polymer components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight polymer alternatives significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
Rubberized grip
Installation of a more comfortable grip.
Titanium trigger assembly
Replacing the various components of the trigger assembly with titanium equivalents greatly increases the weapon's durability.
